fields.description: According to the AWS Ec2 RunInstances documentation the command should support multiple block device mappings. Scroll to BlockDeviceMapping.n in the doc. http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-RunInstances.html The Eucalyptus 3.1 endpoint produces an error when attempting multiple device mappings (on the second mapping, not the first): 412 Precondition FailedFailed to bind the following fields: BlockDeviceMapping.2.VirtualName = ephemeral1 BlockDeviceMapping.2.DeviceName = /dev/sdc Attached is a Python Boto (v2.5) script that can be used to reproduce. Follow instructions in file. Pastebin to log ... http://pastebin.com/F1CULrdh
fields.summary: RunInstances api call needs to support multiple block device mappings

comments.body: This is going to affect the UI in 3.2 because the UI exposes this feature and the functionality is not working. We should consider disabling the UI for this feature if the function doesn't work. Cc: [~dkavanagh], [~jloza]
Sorry guys, just found EUCA-3644 so it looks like the UI team is all over it. Thanks.

Hi [~tgerla] yep we have already changed the UI so that we don't expose any features the CLC doesn't currently support, while still keeping the design extensible for the future when the CLC does support this feature. :) Thanks for tagging this one, though! Appreciate you keeping an eye out to make sure we do things right!
Fixed in the implementation for EUCA-4786

[~mmunn1]: Looks like the run instance request contains two ephemeral device mappings. Euca 3.3 restricts the number of ephemeral mappings to 1. The new behavior along with other bfebs changes are documented in this  [wiki | https://wiki.eucalyptus-systems.com/doku.php?id=changes_to_bfebs_in_3_3] 

Also found this towards the end of the attached test_bdm1.py script

{code}
# comment the following three lines out and it will work on euca
eph1 = BlockDeviceType()
eph1.ephemeral_name = 'ephemeral1'
mapping['/dev/sdc'] = eph1
{code}

You may want to retry the test after commenting out the three lines.

Swathi Gangisetty:  The script does work on Eucalyptus If I comment out the last three lines. I believe that is why this bug was filed in the first place. If you un-comment the last three lines the script works against AWS but fails against Eucalyptus.  I guess the real question is what does this bug actually address multiple 'ephemeral' device mappings 
as the use case suggests or EBS volume device mappings.

As AWS does support multiple 'ephemeral' device mappings this is still an AWS Compatibility issue and in my mind not resolved
I will open a new  AWS Compatibility issue for  multiple 'ephemeral' device mappings and mark this as passed.

[~mmunn1] You are right about AWS supporting multiple ephemeral mappings and Euca not doing so is a bug, but that may not be what this bug is about. Prior to 3.3, Euca (message stack) complained when multiple device mappings were present in the run instances request as recorded in the description. Euca did not process more than one mapping on image registration either. In 3.3 Eucalyptus will detect multiple device mappings and process them accordingly. I thought that was the intent of this bug. 

In the 3.3 release we are supporting multiple EBS mappings for EBS backed instances. However the support for multiple ephemeral mappings is still pending and we throw the appropriate error message. 

I agree with you on a different bug to track the AWS compatibility issue for multiple ephemeral mappings. Thanks!
